<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_bus_finish:
```c
void metal_linux_bus_finish(void)
{
	struct linux_bus *lbus;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	for_each_linux_bus(lbus) {
		if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
			metal_bus_unregister(bus);
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The call metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) passes the address of local variable 'bus' so the callee may store into the object pointed-to (allowed by the rule). At the call site no function parameter is being modified and the pointer itself is not being changed here. (Note: if the implementation of metal_bus_find were to modify the pointer parameter value itself rather than the object it points to, that would violate Rule 17.8, but that cannot be determined from this fragment.)
